data.title: Eton and Winchester sought cut in scholarships
data.meta_description: ETON, Winchester and Westminster collaborated in an attempt to reduce the value of scholarships offered to parents of prospective pupils, according to documents seen by The Times. The three schools
data.text:
ETON, Winchester and Westminster collaborated in an attempt to reduce the value of scholarships offered to parents of prospective pupils, according to documents seen by The Times.

The three schools agreed that fee discounts available to scholars regardless of financial background should be reduced and sought to move in step with each other. They feared that otherwise any school retaining larger discounts would be able to attract the best pupils from prep schools.

Legal experts say that an attempt to co-ordinate a reduction in scholarships could be anti-competitive because it affected the price of the service offered to parents.

Bursars began discussions last autumn about whether they should cut the non-means-tested discount of 50 per cent on fees offered by all three schools. The proposal
